page.title: 08A NOTABLE EVENT
page.content: The most notable event in our locality recently was the building of an extension to the local village school. The work was commenced in August 1985 and completed in December.The original school was built in 1896.When the education committee improved all the schools in the area during the fifties and sixties,Swyddffynnon was on the closure list,with only 11 pupils and 1 teacher.But local opposition kept it open,and numbers increased gradually to secure its future.However the school missed out on modernisation. Now brand new inside toilets and a staffroom have been built.There is a long corridor and spacious cloakroom and even an attic to store books.There are 3 store cupboards to keep books, and a place of her own for the caretaker.The staff have their own toilet.It will be open in January 1986
